title: How to Make an Egg Bake

steps.headline: Remove the crust from 5 slices of white bread, approximately 4 cups (237 g).
steps.description: Cube the bread into 1 inch (2.54 cm) pieces.

steps.headline: Grate 2 cups (241 g) of cheese.
steps.description: You can use cheddar, Monterrey jack, Swiss or a mixture thereof. Save a handful of cheese to sprinkle on top of the egg bake before it goes in the oven.

steps.headline: Chop 3 tbsp.
steps.description: (9.3 g) of chives or green onions.

steps.headline: Chop up vegetables of your choice, such as green pepper, mushrooms, asparagus, seeded tomatoes or a mixture of all of them, adding up to about 1 cup (160 g) of vegetables.
Cook about 2 cups (454 g) of bacon or pork sausage.
steps.description: You can substitute this with diced deli ham or Canadian bacon.

steps.headline: Combine 8 large eggs with 2 cups (473 ml) of milk.
steps.description: Add 1/2 tsp. (2.5 g) of salt, 1/2 tsp. (2.5 g) of pepper and 1 tsp. (2.4 g) of dried mustard. Whisk well.

steps.headline: Grease a 13 by 9 inch (33 by 22.9 cm) baking pan or glass casserole dish with butter or cooking spray.
Layer the bread cubes on the bottom of the baking dish, and then add cheese, vegetables, eggs and meat, in that order.
Cover the dish with a lid or plastic wrap.
Place in the refrigerator overnight.
steps.description: Let it sit for at least 8 hours but no more than 24 hours.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius).
Remove the baking dish from the refrigerator, uncover and sprinkle the handful of cheese you had reserved over the top of the egg bake.
Place the egg casserole in the oven and bake for 45 minutes to an hour.
steps.description: Insert a knife in the center. When it comes out clean, it is done.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: This egg bake recipe yields approximately 10 servings.

text: Remove the crust from 5 slices of white bread, approximately 4 cups (237 g). Cube the bread into 1 inch (2.54 cm) pieces. Grate 2 cups (241 g) of cheese. You can use cheddar, Monterrey jack, Swiss or a mixture thereof. Save a handful of cheese to sprinkle on top of the egg bake before it goes in the oven. Chop 3 tbsp. (9.3 g) of chives or green onions. Chop up vegetables of your choice, such as green pepper, mushrooms, asparagus, seeded tomatoes or a mixture of all of them, adding up to about 1 cup (160 g) of vegetables.  Cook about 2 cups (454 g) of bacon or pork sausage. You can substitute this with diced deli ham or Canadian bacon. Combine 8 large eggs with 2 cups (473 ml) of milk. Add 1/2 tsp. (2.5 g) of salt, 1/2 tsp. (2.5 g) of pepper and 1 tsp. (2.4 g) of dried mustard. Whisk well. Grease a 13 by 9 inch (33 by 22.9 cm) baking pan or glass casserole dish with butter or cooking spray.  Layer the bread cubes on the bottom of the baking dish, and then add cheese, vegetables, eggs and meat, in that order.  Cover the dish with a lid or plastic wrap.  Place in the refrigerator overnight. Let it sit for at least 8 hours but no more than 24 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius).  Remove the baking dish from the refrigerator, uncover and sprinkle the handful of cheese you had reserved over the top of the egg bake.  Place the egg casserole in the oven and bake for 45 minutes to an hour. Insert a knife in the center. When it comes out clean, it is done. Serve immediately. This egg bake recipe yields approximately 10 servings.
sentences: Remove the crust from 5 slices of white bread, approximately 4 cups (237 g).
Cube the bread into 1 inch (2.54 cm) pieces.
Grate 2 cups (241 g) of cheese.
You can use cheddar, Monterrey jack, Swiss or a mixture thereof.
Save a handful of cheese to sprinkle on top of the egg bake before it goes in the oven.
Chop 3 tbsp.
(9.3 g) of chives or green onions.
Chop up vegetables of your choice, such as green pepper, mushrooms, asparagus, seeded tomatoes or a mixture of all of them, adding up to about 1 cup (160 g) of vegetables.
Cook about 2 cups (454 g) of bacon or pork sausage.
You can substitute this with diced deli ham or Canadian bacon.
Combine 8 large eggs with 2 cups (473 ml) of milk.
Add 1/2 tsp.
(2.5 g) of salt, 1/2 tsp.
(2.5 g) of pepper and 1 tsp.
(2.4 g) of dried mustard.
Whisk well.
Grease a 13 by 9 inch (33 by 22.9 cm) baking pan or glass casserole dish with butter or cooking spray.
Layer the bread cubes on the bottom of the baking dish, and then add cheese, vegetables, eggs and meat, in that order.
Cover the dish with a lid or plastic wrap.
Place in the refrigerator overnight.
Let it sit for at least 8 hours but no more than 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius).
Remove the baking dish from the refrigerator, uncover and sprinkle the handful of cheese you had reserved over the top of the egg bake.
Place the egg casserole in the oven and bake for 45 minutes to an hour.
Insert a knife in the center.
When it comes out clean, it is done.
Serve immediately.
This egg bake recipe yields approximately 10 servings.
